_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Company training requires inspections monthly and each time the equipment is operated.
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: Monthly safety equipkment checklist documents inspections.
_prev_prog_2.CT_OtherType: Written test at OAA.  Demonstration and observation at the Facility.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: storage tank, nurse tanks, and ancillary equipment (valves and piping)
_prev_prog_2.Description: The Branch Manager implements the Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Risk Management Program (RMPr) for the Tank Storage & Filling of anhydrous ammonia at this facility and is assisted by other Helena staff as directed. The Risk Management Program includes an Accident Prevention Program that includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Mechanical Integrity,Pre-Startup Review, Compliance Audits, and Incident Investigation. Equipment included under this covered process includes (1) A 30,000-gallon storage tank and ancillary pumps, piping, and valves, (2) a nurse tank filling area and ancillary piping, valves, and hoses, and (4) 18 nurse tanks of various sizes.  Additional equipment includes the Vendor's 8,500-gallon tanker truck and related valves and hoses.  The Vendor is responsible for ensuring that it's equipment is in compliance with applicable and relevant rules (e.g. DOT).

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department.  Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Helena Chemical Company (Helena) Continental Facility has submitted this electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68.  This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the Continental Facility located at 12794 Road 92, Latty, OH 45855.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Continental Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Continental Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release (even though a release is unlikely) will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.

PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP

This RMP includes one covered process: (1) on-site Tank Storage and Filling.  This process will be managed in accordance with the requirements of a Program Level 2.  Helena is resubmitting this RMP as a 5-Year update.  As part of the update, Helena updated the off-site consequence analysis for the worst case and the alternative case release scenarios for each covered process.

FACILITY

The Continental Facility is a retail agricultural chemical facility.  Anhydrous ammonia is currently transported to the Facility via an 8,500-gallon tanker truck and then transferred into the on-site 30,000-gallon storage tank.  The Vendor (i.e. tanker truck operator) is responsible to Helena for complying with relevant operation, maintenance, and training procedures and documentation.  

From the storage tank, the anhydrous ammonia is transferred to 1,000-gallon nurse tanks and sold as retail to the end user.  The on-site tank storage and filling process is performed by qualified and trained Facility personnel.  Facility personnel conduct the storage and filling procedures in accordance with its Operating Procedures.  

OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS

Worst case

and alternative case offsite consequence analyses were completed for Tank Storage and Filling covered process.  The worst case scenario release for the Continental Facility assumes that all the contents of the largest single vessel (a single 30,000-gallon storage tank) are released.  The release was modeled as if the storage tank was punctured on the side at the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as a ground level horizontal jet.

The alternative (or more likely to occur) scenario for the Storage and Filling covered process assumes that the 2-inch liquid transfer pipe is breached during the filling process.  

ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM

The Branch Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Helena facility.  The Branch Manager is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The ammonia storage prevention program is implemented by Helena employees.  Helena employees inspect the markings on the Tanker Truck to ensure that the container is operated within the U.S. DOT inspection requirements and they inspect the Bill of Lading to ensure that the containers are not overfilled.  Helena employees also conduct inspections of the tanker truck and its on-site storage tank for leaking valves and fittings in accordance with the accident program detailed in the Risk Management Program document.  

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

Helena's Continental Facility is a non-responding facility. Helena has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.  Helena has a written Contingency Plan that includes procedures to notify local emergency response agencies in event of a significant ammonia release.  Helena employees will not, under any circumstance, serve as first responders to a significant release of ammonia.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

There have been no on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or s

heltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at the Continental Facility.

CONCLUSION

The Risk Management Plan implemented by Helena Chemical Company at the Continental Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Continental Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the Paulding County LEPC.

NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Continental Facility.
